website_summaries.verdict: A highly-rated and very sturdy drive that can take a lot of abuse.
pros: Metal housing is light-weight, solid, and looks great
Very sturdy for use on a keychain, and no cap to lose
cons: Can get very hot when transferring large files
Some users report that the transfer rates aren’t that great

customer_reviews.title: Good but with a quirk
customer_reviews.text: I really like it's form factor that there is no cap or cover to slide. One quirk is while it works fine on my Linux pc, on a windows pc, windows wouldn't recognize it on the front panel but did on the back panel so I use a USB extension cable to the back. According to Google it's a common problem with flash drives that I hadn't run into before that some flash drives won't work with some USB hubs, which is basically what the front panel USB is.
customer_reviews.author: doubleganger

customer_reviews.title: Failing after 21 months
customer_reviews.text: I have had a lot of nice(more expensive) and cheap (cruzers) flash drives and never had one stop working. After 21 months this flash drive has given up. Constantly connecting and disconnecting from computer. 4 laptops were used. Finally copied the contents, used windows scan and repair, then reformatted to NTFS. Worked for 2 days and then the problems began. Not so sure it's the drive as much as the actual connector. The reason I purchased this drive was to limit the flexibility of the drive at it's weakest point, the USB connector. This is the shortest lived drive I've ever had. I still have a 16GB USB 2.0 drive that functions from 2009. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: ElecEnthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Go-to utility drive for installing OSes... worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: If you build bootable flashdrives, this is the one to use. You really do not want to waste 45 minutes on a suspect drive. Boots on every piece of hardware I tested it with, and more importantly, every system (Mac OS, Windows XP through 10, all kinds of Linux, Raspian, etc.) It's USB 3 and well-implemented at that... it screams at taking those images from Etcher, USB creation tools, DiskMaker X, etc. I bought (4) 32GB models and keep (2) of them as my permanent OS-reinstall drives, and use the other 2 as my "system du jour" restore drives. Build quality is excellent. Have had no failures to mount... these are my "golden standard" / "known good" drives.
customer_reviews.author: terpsichorean

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Speeds
customer_reviews.text: While this tiny things looks and feels amazing that's about all its good for. The transfer speeds are a joke. I tried several USB 3.0 drives and gets speeds from only 20-30 MB/second. My USB 2.0 flash drive is faster than this. The flash drive also feels hot after being plugged in. I will be seeking a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Adan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing speed
customer_reviews.text: This drive only delivers an average of about 30 megabytes per second speed when copying data onto it. Much less than I was hoping for from the leader in fast VNAND flash memory, Samsung AND a now mature fast data transfer standard, USB 3.0. This compares to a cheap 16GB generic flash drive with USB 2.0 which ran at 11.5 megabytes per second. This test was on the same USB 3.0 motherboard attached port on the back of a fast PC copying the same 660MB folder from a Samsung 850 Pro SSD drive connected to an internal SATA3 port.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Try
customer_reviews.text: After, it was all metal. Nice design. The connector isn't bare, which I believed would result in less chance of damage. I have my whole life on flash drives. I and my business depend upon it. I use it very, very heavily Well, after about 5 months, it only connected intermittently. And unpredictably. I thought it might have been the computer. But the same happened on other computers. Bought the Lexar Jump Twist. Problem gone.
customer_reviews.author: shantinik

customer_reviews.title: OMG so CLASSY!!! Edit: unreliable connection
customer_reviews.text: I can't emphasize enough how much I like this drive. Not only is it tiny, but its so shiny! Also the clip is nice, I keep it on my keyring now. Its very small and light, and doesn't take much space on the keyring. I might recommend getting a little clip so it doesn't have to hang all your keys on the USB port. Its up to you though, its possible over time it'd damage it. Still overall, I've never seen a classier flash drive! Edit: 5 Stars -> 3 Stars I've had intermittent connectivity issues with this drive. Overall it's still usable, but the connection isn't as reliable as id like. Not cumbersome enough to buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Great style and durable
customer_reviews.text: Looking at most of the reviews , I chose the Samsung USB 3.0 Flash Drive 32. Being that it is metal, water proof, shock proof, magnet proof, temperature proof and x-ray proof, what more can I say. This little gadget is super. My computer is 9 years old and I am in the process of looking for a new one before it dies. It is working great but it is still old. I managed to copy all my documents, pictures, music, video files with the flash drive and still have plenty of space left. I have 2 Samsung TVs and they never failed us and that is another reason I chose the flash drive.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Really neat flash drive, it works and it looks cool - Steve Jobs would be proud
customer_reviews.text: Really cool shape, perfect for our aerospace oriented son. High quality feel, but very light also. Good capacity, you're not going to run out of space unless you try pretty hard. Fast enough, esp. on USB 3 connection. Just a minor point that it's a bit hard to get a key ring on the loop, but it's a one time install. Re: sturdiness, it's been clipped to the exterior of my high school son's backpack for months, and still working. The insertion end is not covered, hasn't gotten dirty to the point where it doesn't work, but if you're in a very dusty / dirty environment that might be a consideration.
customer_reviews.author: EricY

customer_reviews.title: Works well and fast
customer_reviews.text: I had been purchasing budget flash drives to record music, they are slow and break without notice. This is a fast flash drive. It is made of metal, hopefully it will be durable, I don't expect to drive over it with my car. The music sounds great, no lights flashing, connecting it was easy. I will not be buying cheap flash drives anymore. I'll place my favorite music on this drive and see if I can wear it out like you were able to do with records back in the day.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Randomly died after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Very well built, but can get quite toasty when plugged in, particularly when plugged into a powered hub. This flash drive does not appear to have any sort of power or access indicator on it like most do, though. UPDATE December 2019: although the flash drive was only being used to store some software licenses (which is why I got this drive which is supposedly nearly everything-proof), it randomly and without warning began rapidly disconnecting and reconnecting and became unrecognizable and unusable regardless of what port or computer it's plugged into. Samsung has yet to provide their RMA shipping label despite waiting 2 weeks for it.
customer_reviews.author: James E.

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable and not at all static proof
customer_reviews.text: The slightest bit of static will burn this right out permanently. If you're going to use these make absolutely sure you're in a static free environment and that includes 16 Gb version as well I had two 16 Gb and one blew out just like the 32Gb the other I'm very careful with but i have zero confidence in it.. I've been using flash drives since they became commercially viable and I have never lost one this way before. I have about 12-14 flash drives and all of them still work fine. One is ten years old. I bought it in 1999 and I still keep a lot of valuable data on it and it's been flawless.
customer_reviews.author: mjtrahar64

customer_reviews.title: Samsung quality.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for a drive this size and super fast. EDIT JUNE 21 2018 This drive has failed as others have said. I have used it exactly twice to transfer files and it freezes any pc I use it in and gets uncomfortably warm .I expected more from this brand and I use other Samsung products that have no issues at all. Returning for refund. Not sure what the issue is, I have thumb drives that are 5 years old and still function as intended, this one is a head scratcher.
customer_reviews.author: KF

customer_reviews.title: Read the write up ... see what you think.
customer_reviews.text: I am NOT a Samsung fan. Most of their inventory is overpriced, regardless of item. These are uniquely SMALL flash drives and they're metal. ALMOST indestructible. They're the first I would not be overly concerned about having on a key chain in my pocket. When I travel, I always carry a flash drive. You never know who you'll bump into and be able to share stuff with as well as load some things you didn't know about. Very tiny fingerprint on the tech world.
customer_reviews.author: DanoTop Contributor: Bob Dylan

customer_reviews.title: will stay on your keychain and works admirably
customer_reviews.text: Until I got these, every otherwise functional sandisk or other thumb drive broke off my key chain. They were all plastic. I went looking for metal and found this. I've gone back to buy more b/c they work and they last and all things considered the price is fair too. and hey, if Trump starts a war with North Korea, you may not be able to get these much longer... anyhow, this gets my highest rating: a niche product that fills a need admirably, without fuss or muss or undue expense.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen H. Orel

customer_reviews.title: Forced to buy because of aliens...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this flash drive to replace an old plastic PNY that I lost. Okay, I didn't lose it. Aliens took it, I swear. It literally vanished without a trace. Aliens. I got this flash drive for three reasons: 1) USB 3.0 and YES it's fast! 2) It's "everything proof" which is a much needed upgrade. 3) It's made of metal, so aliens won't be able to vaporize it (alien proof?). It's an odd shape; my boss thought it was a whistle when he first saw it. Gets the job done and that's all I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher K.

customer_reviews.title: SUPER slow transfer speeds
customer_reviews.text: not sure what is up with this, but it takes 10x as long to transfer data to this device than any other usb stick I have. while i suppose it still works, i have to say ill stick to the sandisk stuff as its never let me down. thankfully i got this on some super discount sale on prime day so i cant really complain much.
customer_reviews.author: BrianR

customer_reviews.title: Solid Flash Drive
customer_reviews.text: I have had this thing for over 2 years now and it is still working great. I have left it attached to my keys and it has gotten thrown around and beat up and still works! Samsung makes high quality products and this is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Reads Fast, Writing Not so Much.
customer_reviews.text: Nice design, solid build, and reading speed is very fast, but writing speed is only about 16MB/s, Other USB 3.0 devices write faster on my system - typically around 40 MB/s. Does not get significantly hot when transferring large files. I've written 3GB files at the maximum rate of 16MB/s with no appreciable heating. FYI, SanDisk Ultrafit writes at 26 MB/s but will slow down to 16 MB/s after about 1GB of transfer at the higher rate and does get noticeably warm. SanDisk Cruzer USB 2.0 writes at about 4.5 MB/s, so this is still 3x faster than a USB 2.0 flash drive.
customer_reviews.author: Bob B

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully designed; disaster ensued.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this drive aesthetically; it is well designed, not prone to bending or coming apart when used a lot, and the hanging hole built into the housing of it made it every easy to put on a keychain or lanyard. I thought it was a good deal, but it failed catastrophically in a way that seems to indicate physical rather than logical damage. I could be wrong about it, but I lost lots of important data, and I've never had a USB drive become unrecognizable like that before, so I will probably not buy this particular drive again. Maybe it was just bad luck.
customer_reviews.author: runnergirrl

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: Too slippery to take out, the ring at the end physically interferes with other usb devices. The metal housing also is more difficult to insert than more normal usb sticks. Lately I've been having connection issues with this usb stick on multiple computers. I have to insert it just right to get that connection. Update: Connections issues was because of pocket lint in the housing. Other design issues still hold.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Huge Capacity!
customer_reviews.text: It's a hardy piece of equipment that works right out of the package and has never failed. At 32 GB, the storage capacity is large enough to use as my primary document backup (uncompressed), rather than using a Windows partition (which never made sense to me). So far, I'm able to hold 3 rounds of backups at once, and still only use half the capacity. Retrieval is lightning fast, so sometimes I have to double check that I'm pulling from the USB instead of the hard drive. This USB is a 10/10!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 7 Months in my Netgear R9000 Router
customer_reviews.text: Was using it for my Plex database (router requires Plex DB to be on a USB-connected device even if you have a NAS for media storage). This device worked fine for months and then died. A computer sees it, then doesn't, sees it again, then doesn't, over and over. I did manage to do a long format on it on one machine that managed to see it for a while, but it still didn't work play nice in the router. If the mfr return/replace process goes smoothly, I'll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: When I got a new car I wasn't able to play my CDs anymore because CD players are not in cars anymore. I had to rip all my CD music which was so time consuming but after I got it all ripped, I burned it to the drive and it was so easy I didn't think it worked so I ended up ripping all the music twice lol. Then I went back and deleted the 2nd set. It worked really good and now I have all my music on 1 little bitty piece of metal. I will definitely buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I believe it's just an average stick
customer_reviews.text: HEAT. Way too much...in fact I've never felt any heat from a thumb drive before. Heat is not the best friend of SSD technology, and I don't know why it is heating so much. I have not copied anything to it yet....it was just plugged into my laptop for 20 minutes or so. Knowing this, I will not buy another Samsung thumb drive out of concern what the heat may do. other reviewers say the heat won't hurt it. Also, no cap to keep junk like pocket dust out.
customer_reviews.author: LT1234455666

customer_reviews.title: Well made but poorly designed to include on a keychain.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this USB flash drive to keep on my keychain so I could transfer files between work and home. It is well made with the exception of the protruding keyring hole. I've been finding that the USB drive rarely rests flat against my keys in my pocket. It sticks out and is very annoying. I'm now looking at other USB keychain drives that will rest flat against my keys. All in all, this a high quality USB drive, but poorly designed for the one purpose I purchased it for: resting comfortably on my keychain.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gee

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I liked the flash drive when it worked, but it only lasted about 6 months. I might have used it 5 times and it just quit working. I wouldn't buy another one. I've lost a lot of faith in Samsung products the past couple of years. Their products are not lasting very long anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Kim U

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 34 days!
customer_reviews.text: My drive got hot a few days ago but still worked. Today it now showed up as device malfunctioning. I tried to plug into another computer and now I don't even get that. Drive died only after 34 days, just long enough so Amazon won't take the return. I haven't even really put much stress on it for transfers yet. Roughly moved 15 gigs to it and it has been maintained at that level until now. Now I am lacking a flash drive for my job. P.S. It really is a shame because I did like having the strong metal ring on it for my key ring.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: here this little guy is lackluster AT best. i was able to peak 100mbs on a ...
customer_reviews.text: well it is made very well, the design,size,build quality are superb! flash drives however are about performance too, here this little guy is lackluster AT best. i was able to peak 100mbs on a 3gb transfer, it only did this for about 3 seconds and then reduced to 25-30mbs which it maintained for the rest of the transfer. i find this to be acceptable, however completely deceptive!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Friedlein

customer_reviews.title: Can get quite hot, but very solid metal construction
customer_reviews.text: This has very fast read speeds, being the fastest Flash drive I have and measured at 142 MB/s Read with Black Magic. In terms of write speed it's slower, at bout half the speed of comparably priced high quality USB 3.0 Flash drives and scored at around 27MB/s write speed. It can get quite hot during large data transfers, but the metal body dissipates heat very well and it's very solidly made. In terms of reliability, I guess time will tell. Overall it's not bad, but I'd like it to have faster write speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Theo Corfiatis

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly with PS4 & PS4 Pro
customer_reviews.text: Just an FYI, this (32GB) works perfectly with PS4 and PS4 Pro. I've had others that are tough to get in the slot due to size/location, and some that did not recognize, this does both perfectly! It fits without any forcing and is recognized upon boot, awesome value, and great construction. As a tip, once you load this up with game saves, copy the data to your PC for extra protection, it beats using PS Plus and costs you nothing, as where PS Plus has a monthly/yearly charge to save your data.
customer_reviews.author: WeaponX

customer_reviews.title: This little thing goes on and on, and still works
customer_reviews.text: After having this memory for years, it has travel a lot, been in the washing machine, supported my weight because I sat on it a lot, and still works good as new. It has scratches, the top has bended a little and it is a bit more difficult to put in on the sub port, but nothing you can not handle. Amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: tiko.col

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Durable Little Thumb Drive
customer_reviews.text: I attached this little drive to my key chain almost a year ago now. I like that not only is it still working, but it's also still attached to my key chain. I usually either crush them or loose them because they break off my key chain. I take my keys backpacking, camping, rafting, and all sorts of other places thumb drives have no place being. Despite all that it keeps working.
customer_reviews.author: GeekFrog

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product for Price
customer_reviews.text: The Samsung USB flash drive is quite compact and seems very sturdy. I looked around the house for short / old lanyards to attach to the two drives I purchased, because these come without any cord attached. I would recommend something like the camera lanyards be included, but a little consumer ingenuity helps - even a shoe string would suffice to ensure the drive doesn't get lost in the bottom of a backpack or elsewhere. Nice product.
customer_reviews.author: UT

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, but ditch the keyring idea
customer_reviews.text: Well-made, sturdy little drives, but awkward on a keyring. You should not put these on a keyring because they will get banged up fast. Haven't tried to see if they're water resistant, because any reasonable person will tell you that electronics and water don't mix, but I can say they do hold up well to the environment, from cold weather to Arizona temps.
customer_reviews.author: J. G. Smerda

customer_reviews.title: Terrible drive, too late to return it
customer_reviews.text: Averages 120F during extended reading and writing making it very uncomfortable to touch. Speeds are terrible. 25MBps write, 35MBps read max. I tried NTFS, FAT32, exFAT, and EXT4. I tested on my MSI GE62VR laptop on USB 3.1 running Windows 10 and an HP desktop on USB 3.0 running Ubuntu 18.04. If speed isn't a worry for you then this drive is nice and sturdy, but for me these are worthless trash, I have USB 2.0 drives almost as fast as this.
customer_reviews.author: herculeesjr

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but the odd shape isn't worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I won't lie, style points definitely came into play when I was buying this. And it does look good, the problem being that the Shape itself is very odd. Due to the curve it doesn't fit on a keyring so that it sits flat, so it often will be pointed in a weird direction (usually right into your leg if you keep your keyring in your pocket all the time). I did have some data corrupt on this on more than one occasion, but I can't say for sure why it happened so I won't pin it on the drive.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Cute and Classy USB
customer_reviews.text: This just arrived in the mail today! I'm incredibly excited about this product. I've been looking for a USB Flash Drive for a while, especially because I freelance and travel often. This Samsung USB is everything I could want in a product. Unlike other, cheaper, USBs this has a lovely metallic finish, good upload speed, and is waterproof! I was skeptical about the design at first, but I'm glad I decided to buy this. It's smaller than I'd expect, however, that's not a drawback at all! It fits on my keychain and isn't a complete eyesore. We'll see how it holds up over the next couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Mc

customer_reviews.title: This is an attractive drive with fantastic storage capacity for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is an attractive drive with fantastic storage capacity for the price, but it comes formatted with a FAT32 file system that prohibits you from moving items larger than about 4 GB. Reformatting this little thing to a different file system is easy, but it took me awhile to figure out why I couldn't load it up with the file I'd bought it to load up with! After I reformatted it, this USB drive has been great to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Bradd Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Useless. Poor fit in USB port, no protective cap...and it failed after 3 uses, can't read/write after only transferring 3GB of files. Just avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Schumann

customer_reviews.title: Could not create bootable Win 10
customer_reviews.text: #@ GB metal USB. Can transfer files to it ok, but I have been unable to create a bootable Windows 10 drive. Have used it on 2 different computers using several ISO to USB burning programs. None worked including the Microsoft Windows 7 USB DVD Download Tool. Finally plugged in an old, plastic Lexar drive and completed the bootable setup using the Microsoft Windows 7 USB DVD tool.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Dead after little use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these when they were on sale while back. 2 have since died and no longer register on either my work issued Windows Laptop, my MacBook Pro or iMac computers. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: R1200GSA

customer_reviews.title: Product is not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that the product has following flaws: - Gets very hot - Interferes with your USB wireless mouse if next to it - Does not store up to its claim of 32GB. It comes out as 29GB which is expected but for me it only stored around 20GB after that it started to give me drive full error - Very slow to write large media file. Read was fine I am returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: KmanCT

customer_reviews.title: A great little tool for infotainment updates
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to think a USB drive of this size, speed, and storage can be had for so cheap. The build quality of this drive is amazing and the design is really beautiful. I have several other USB 3.0 drives around the house but it's just really convenient to have this little thing on the keychain. Because of its uniform shape from tip to tip, I have used it to perform infotainment software updates on several of our vehicles in the family. Definitely recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ross Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Durable, versatile, but formatted with on 16GB available
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this USB, I was moving a couple videos on it to move it to my other computer to avoid using my horrible upload speed, but it filled up faster than I thought. When I looked at the properties of it, I saw it was only showing 16GB. It was fixed by formatting it myself to get the 32GB. I'm IT Tech by profession so this is easy for me to solve/troubleshoot, but it won't be easy for some other users if this happens to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: EssieJessie

customer_reviews.title: Too fast for windows via 3.0
customer_reviews.text: Its so fast that windows 10 cant be downloaded via a 3.0 port. It skips at the 50% mark due to a flash to enable the drive as a boot drive. It disconnects and reconnects in order to continue but being fast and in a port 3.0 usb, it connects so fast that it causes a error in the download of windows 10. Would recommond to anyone that has both a usb 2.0 and 3.0 only laptops/desktop( 2.0 is ur failsafe!)
customer_reviews.author: Seabass

customer_reviews.title: Great for keys, speed competes with the best budget 3.0's
customer_reviews.text: One of the fastest 3.0's I have. I systematically upgraded all my flash drives to 3.0 recently, and wanted a travel one for my keys (college files, you know?). I was previously using a, but the damn thing got bent in just a day in my pocket! I can safely say this Samsung is incredibly fast and durable. Looks great on my keys. Yeah, it has scratches on it from a few weeks of use, but it's much better than the alternatives. I bought it for $16, but the price has been reduced quite a bit! Definitely get one for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: icykyl

customer_reviews.title: Better Choices Aavailable
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but I only used it for recovery drive so I am unable to comment on read/write speeds. Quality seems marginal, USB drive doesn't fit tightly in computer, sort of wiggles around and I am not sure if it is correctly in the socket though it does work OK. I prefer the physically smaller thumb drives like the SanDisk Ultra Fit]drives for the same price because they snap in cleanly and don't stick out where they can be damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff2468

customer_reviews.title: Died, just like that
customer_reviews.text: I like the form factor but the deal breaker so to speak is that the stick died just after year of very light usage. It mounted one moment, restarted the machine and it didn't come back. Complete dead. No luck on any computer. THat sucks and doesn't provide much confident for mission critical operation. Showing up at a presentation, in class, or anything, and the data you though you have with you is not accessible. Sorry, but the replacement USB stick won't be another Samsung. Have to cross that off my brand list.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Rothermich

customer_reviews.title: Great Drive!
customer_reviews.text: Love this flash drive. It fits seamlessly on my key chain. I was told by a co-worker that they didn't even know that I had a thumb drive on my key ring. The price when I got it was cheaper than most of the drives available in stores in my area, and none of those were metal. My last drive that I had on my key chain fell apart as it was plastic. I am not worried about that happening as this one is all metal.
customer_reviews.author: FreelanceViper

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't play well on key chain (deal breaker)
customer_reviews.text: The usb key itself as a mass storage device is very adequate. The odd shape however makes the keychain a pain to keep on the keychain. It tends to stick out in odd ways making your keychain bundle larger and sharper. For this reason I have to dock a few points since it became a deal breaker for me to carry around and use.
customer_reviews.author: Edih

customer_reviews.title: Fast and physically small.
customer_reviews.text: IT is much faster than my old USB 2 flash drive. Be warned, it is SMALL so is easily lost through, say, a hole in the pocket. I've nearly lost it several times in the few weeks I've had it. I know it's a cliche, but I figured out that this holds the information of a whole truck full, literally, of the old (32K) floppy disks I used to use. It's a million(!) of those disks in one teany stick. A million. Say, each floppy disk weighted an ounce (probably an under estimate), That's 30 tons of disks. The biggest 18 wheelers can carry 40 tons.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Ruina

customer_reviews.title: Loved this so much bought two more!
customer_reviews.text: You cannot go wrong purchasing this item especially if you need a flash drive. Highly recommend it, as a network engineer I get plenty of use out of mine. Durability is no joke on this either. In my professional and personal opinion this is more than worth the money. I got the 32gb ones but planning on purchasing the 64gb one soon too.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Incredible little flash drive
customer_reviews.text: Tired of flash drives that break or lose their caps? This one is amazing--though it's tiny (clip it on a key ring) it has a big capacity and it's practically everything-proof (one reviewer said it went through the wash in a pocket and is still working). Can't ask for more than that.
customer_reviews.author: E. Goodling

customer_reviews.title: Transfers Files as Advertised but Expensive
customer_reviews.text: The durable MUF-32BA/AM has transferred a couple of notepad, word and picture files as advertised, unlike the flimsy and complete failure after 3 months using P-FD128GTBOP-GE. Contrarily, MUF-32BA/AM is expensive compared to my excellent reviewed 64GB MB-ME64GA/AM, which is more compact, has twice the drive space and gives similar results.
customer_reviews.author: Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: I am an Animation student so I needed a trusty flash drive that would be able to save and transfer my huge project files from school to home. The speed is fast, as it doesn't take long for me to transfer 3-4gb worth of data over to my portable hard drive. I have owned this flash drive for almost a year now, and use it mostly everyday. I have it attached to my keys and have dropped them countless times. There are dents and scratches all over the flash drive, but it is still working good as new. I would highly recommend this flash drive to anyone looking for a durable and trusty flash drive.
customer_reviews.author: Sou

customer_reviews.title: 0 port for your computer you should be fine, but ive had a few devices that cant ...
customer_reviews.text: it does fast speeds, if youre using them in a 3.0 port for your computer you should be fine, but ive had a few devices that cant recognize these, they just dont show up, or theyll take a long time, or theyll randomly disconect, its annoying to say the least, I couldnt get them to work in a usb extender, I think they must draw a lot of power or something
customer_reviews.author: ViceVersa

customer_reviews.title: TRANSFER SPEED FAR FROM 150 MB/S
customer_reviews.text: Nice metallic USB flashdrive but sold without encrypted secure access software to protect your personal information. The transfer speed are far away from the announced speed (150 MB/S). With the blackmagic speed test tool I got 31.6 MB/S in writing and 38.1 MB/S in reading and in transfer from USB to USB I got 11.8 MB/S.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHRONRON

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 6 Weeks
customer_reviews.text: Was a little "flakey" from the start and had to wiggle it around and change ports to get it to work. Worked after that for a month or so then just stopped being recognized. I've tried it in several USB 3.0 and 2.0 ports plus (2 machines + several hubs).
customer_reviews.author: Marty913

customer_reviews.title: Small, Sleek, and Well-Built
customer_reviews.text: Incredible design and sleek look. This Flash Drive is perfect for hooking onto a key ring, and it fits neatly into the USB port on a laptop which then provides enough space for other connections as well. I was able to format it for MAC fairly quickly. It still transfers files at a steady pace, but I think my Macbook Pro only has USB 2.0 ports, so I'm not functioning at maximum capacity for the Stick. I would recommend getting a few of these!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 months.  I wouldn't trust Samsung for flash drives.
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would be a good quality flash drive, considering the brand name. It worked great for 3 months and then started to have issues that put it constantly into a "fix" mode. I would run through the fixes, but it continued to go into "fix mode." This flash drive also ran very hot.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot123

customer_reviews.title: Durable and awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Does what it should, 8mo+ later still works. I use it in a manufacturing environment so when i saw this with the metal case i knew i needed this one. The shell is really durable and has taken a beating with very minimal ware on the outside other than some scratches, still works perfect. Even ran over it with a forklift for laughs, no damage, still works.
customer_reviews.author: Drjeebus

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic USB for keychains.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a little over 2 years and still use it regularly with no problems. It's kept on my keychain so it sees mild abuse I would say. It's exactly what I was looking for: small, durable, and works. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy, fits on a keychain!
customer_reviews.text: I heard and saw some of the reviews about it not fitting the keychain appropriately, but as you can see it does fit you just have to put it on correctly! Overall this thing is fast and user friendly. I have it for at least six months and no problems. It does get hot very quickly, but I don't keep it in my laptop long or any other computer.
customer_reviews.author: chrystal 0

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t do without it
customer_reviews.text: This product saved me! In a long stretch of working with an unpredictable computer in the midst of a very important project, I knew I could rest securely knowing that my files were safe on this flash drive. The space is more than adequate and the price is fair. I would purchase this again. The only reason I knocked off a star is because of how hot it gets.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: 4 Years and Going Strong
customer_reviews.text: While my keyring/lanyard, car keys, and house keys have changed in the past 4 years, this USB has been the only thing to remain the same. Using it consistently for random school & office file sharing, it hasn't let me down. Solid purchase and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Not as Fast as Publicized
customer_reviews.text: This drive was listed as being much faster than it turned out to be. I researched USB 3 flash drives and this one was highly rated. In actuality, it's not I own at Corsair USB 3 drive that writes at 22 MB/s while this one wrote the same exact set of files totaling 10 GB at 12 MB/s. I returned this drive to buy the 32 GB Corsair.
customer_reviews.author: Doug N

customer_reviews.title: Amazing USB Flashdrive with blazing speeds
customer_reviews.text: The Samsung USB flash drive is phenomenal for only 14$ It has amazing speed at USB 3 and is 32GB compared to most other USB sticks that sell at around 15$ for only 16GB. Pros: It is extremely light Amazing build quality even though it is made out of aluminum it is very sturdy Very fast speeds A LOT of storage Cons: Tiny so it is easy to lose For some USB ports it is hard to stick in Overall the USB flashdrive is amazing for its price and its speed. I would highly recommend buying this over brands such as Hyper X's flash drives.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Song

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I rarely use it, and when I do it's for about half an hour to an hour transferring files. So far it's worked well and hasn't died. My complaints would be heating issues, but that's an issue for basically any jump drive. I can see this failing like others have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cardone

customer_reviews.title: Will jut out oddly on keyring occasionally due to keyring-hole design.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on sale for ~$15. Works as intended and very durable. Only con is that it is a bit oddly shaped on the keyring and causes items not to lay flat. I like to have a really minimal flat keyring on my carabiner that I clip to my back belt loop and slide keys into my back pocket, but it way this hooks to my key ring makes that a bit harder. I wished that the hole for the keyring was a traditional at the top hole rather than curving out.
customer_reviews.author: Shuchen Chiang, Dennis Jow

customer_reviews.title: Bad product. Worse support.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible thumb drive. I've only had it for a few months, and it's locked itself down to where I can't reformat, can't add files, can't delete files, etc. I gave up an entire day trying various fixes to no avail. Then I contacted Samsung support. It's still in warranty, but apparently I won't be getting a replacement as they have yet to get back to a few months later after several attempts.
customer_reviews.author: Tyrinari

customer_reviews.title: I would suggest looking for something that's better quality
customer_reviews.text: I have bought so far maybe 10 of these and I have had atleast 5 of them suddenly die on me. They just stopped working and read 128kb and I tried everything to fix them and they wouldn't work. The other 5 however are working perfectly so it's a bit or now situation on this product. I would suggest looking for something that's better quality
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: Great flash drive and the price was right
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed by this Samsung USB 3.0 flash drive. First, it looks good - I love the simple, sleek metal design and the utility of the hole that allows for a chain or cord to be attached. Second, it's fast...data writes to it much faster than my PNY USB drive that's a little older and was geared for USB 2.0. Not much else to say - a great flash drive and the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: it lays funny on keys
customer_reviews.text: Does the job as a flash drive, but because of the way the loop is, it lays funny on keys. On one side it will lie nice and flat, but if it is the other way it stick out at an angle.
customer_reviews.author: Aiden

customer_reviews.title: Portable and readable flash drive
customer_reviews.text: This flash drive is really handy and easy to hang on a keychain The 32GB size is more than enough for my daily use. I had a previous Kingston flash drive but for some reason It wasn't readable by many devices and I had to move it around different USB ports without any success. I did not have any problem with the Samsung flash drive and I am very satisfied with it
customer_reviews.author: ahmedsammad

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fast- look at the customer photos! This thing seems to move files at speeds similar to spinning hard drives! Of course, that does require a usb 3.0 port! I have several flash drives that for whatever reason do not work with OS installers, and I have successfully installed windows 10 from this drive twice! The picture makes it look big, but its actually pretty small and fits nicely on my keychain. And who can complain about 32GB for $10!!
customer_reviews.author: K. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Quality product for important tasks - very fair price.  Different than any others I've seen, claims to be super durable.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like one seriously durable and hopefully reliable Flash Drive which I purchased to create a system recovery image. I held back the fifth star because there is no indicator light to show that it's active and working. Nice small size, though does lack any kind of protection for the USB connection which won't be a big deal for me since I'm protecting it like gold.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Straw

customer_reviews.title: This drive is fantastic.It holds all my medical information.
customer_reviews.text: This drive is fantastic. I am wearing one around my neck. It holds all my medical information. II chose it because it is resistant to so many environmental threats. It is also small so it can go on a neck chain and be comfortable. I also use them for backup. I just copy my files to them. I will never use backup software again. Backup software is great at backing up .But restore is a real bag of worms (I have tried several programs, don't tell me there is one that works all the time)
customer_reviews.author: Xenogeny Smith

customer_reviews.title: Honestly, I purchased this for durability and material quality!
customer_reviews.text: And boy, Samsung delivered! This is a solid piece of USB. Pure metal. Waterproof. Gorgeous design. And quick transfer. Gave one to daughter and she said a lot of people complimented the USB. Worth the price and will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: J.Le

customer_reviews.title: Survived A Trip Through My Washing Machine
customer_reviews.text: I just tested this flash drive in a way I didn't intend. I accidently left it in my pants pocket and then washed the pants. This little flash drive went through the complete cycle. I figured it would be dead, but I let it dry overnight and then plugged it into my laptop. Works just fine! And it is now clean and smells springtime fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Tickle

customer_reviews.title: Bombproof USB 3. 0 jump drive. Small enough ...
customer_reviews.text: Bombproof USB 3.0 jump drive . Small enough to swallow if you have secret agents trying to recover the microfilm you have digitally xfered to .Gif or .Mov files to this. Also , modern design aesthetic could permit wearing this as modern art necklace or if you are hardcore , you could epoxy 10 of these to you fingernails and become a superhero called "Digital Digit Man" or " StorageFinger" if you were so inclined
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery

customer_reviews.title: These are great USB drives
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality of these usb's I have had plastic ones that have broken in my pocket before. I carry these around all the time and do not worry about them breaking because of the metal shell. I have not had to use tech support so I did not rate that.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoMaker

customer_reviews.title: I've had this flash drive for about 2 years and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this flash drive for about 2 years and have stored a lot of personal and sentimental info on it. Sometime 2 weeks ago, I misplaced it and couldn't find it. I was really upset. As my hubby did laundry a couple days ago putting the washed load into the dryer, he saw my flash drive at the bottom of the washer. So after going through a complete wash in the washer, my flash drive still worked! That in itself is worth a 5 star product rating!
customer_reviews.author: K3rriB3rri

customer_reviews.title: kinda futuristic looking --
customer_reviews.text: sleek, kinda futuristic looking. no moving parts like a swing-back cover. I attached a ring to it for easier handling as it's so slick it's a tad difficult to pickup. I'd give it 5 stars except it doesn't have a light as part of it. Every thumb drive I've had had a built in led that lit up/flashed when used. I missed that here.
customer_reviews.author: steve Hauk

customer_reviews.title: Died After A Year
customer_reviews.text: After mild and sporadic use for barely more than a year, my stick stopped working abruptly, and cannot be read by any devices or utilities. Useless hunk of metal now. Luckily I was using it simply to transfer files, so nothing important was solely backed up on it, but if you want to use it for anything but that, go with a different brand, or a cheaper one that won't sting as much if it dies on you.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bryce

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: 4.5 stars for this usb stick. Works well, looks great. The only con is the side that plugs into the computer gets scratched very easily. On my first try, I noticed there were already scratches on it. No biggie, since it doesn't affect the function of the product, but I was hoping it wouldn't scratch so easily, hence deducted half a star.
customer_reviews.author: BubbleMilky

customer_reviews.title: Big speed, really small package.
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best USB drives for price/performance; it's noticeably faster than the stick it replaced for about the same money. Not much else to say here, since it works so well. I'm likely to purchase more of these. Just be careful not to lose it, because it's really, really tiny.
customer_reviews.author: Scottie Owens

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, speeds not quite as advertised
customer_reviews.text: First off, you will probably not ever get the advertised speeds, but other than that WOW... I needed something to carry around for school projects and a phone/ backup and this was perfect. The design is sleek and very sturdy, not something I am afraid to lose because it broke off. Overall, the only reason it did not receive 5 stars is because so far my transfer speeds have not exceeded 60mps transfer, but still really quick!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Mollis

customer_reviews.title: Works great. used for programming cars
customer_reviews.text: My fiance ordered these to use for work. He has to have a USB drive to store programming for vehicles on and then flash it to the vehicle. He works as an auto technician for an auto dealership. He does almost all of their electronics and drivability, which involves a lot of vehicle programming. Occasionally the dealership will have multiple new vehicles that need to have programming completed. He also ordered another one for a co-worker so apparently the USB flash drive works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Erica B.

customer_reviews.title: Clean, Efficient, Professional
customer_reviews.text: Defaults as a FAT32 drive I believe, so if you want to transfer anything more than 5 GB you can't unless you format it to exFAT or NTFS. This thing looks so professional, and yet all I store on it are movies, media, and projects. It holds a lot and that's all I'm really asking for but this is a solid choice for a flash drive. I recommend it because it looks cool and you an attach it to your keychain or something, I dunno. Do whatevers with it, mannn.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Stupid shape
customer_reviews.text: It works fine but the hole for putting it on a keychain is weird and causes it to be at a right angle to the keys on the ring.... just kinda dumb.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Sweeny

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great product, but the way its made to fit in your key ring is kind of awkward and most of the times I struggle to plug it in, but it’s great for small applications like college work or moving files.
customer_reviews.author: Zippyman

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Perfect and stylish
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made Flash drive! I wanted to put all my wedding photos on a flash drive so I bought this based on the look (wanted to easily identify this flash drive) and the storage. I’ve stored about 2,000 photos so far and that barely touched the total memory. I could probably store every picture I have digitally on this
customer_reviews.author: jimmytown

customer_reviews.title: Small, nice looking, works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this with a TCL Roku TV. It allows me to pause and play broadcast television. Works like a charm. Small and easy to plug in. I'll probably buy a few more. I like the higher data transfer rate of the 3.0 USB drives, and this one doesn't disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Jeena

customer_reviews.title: which is a good thing for me
customer_reviews.text: It is much smaller than I expected, which is a good thing for me. The loop is not angled in a way that allows me to add it to my key-chain in a practical way, but thats fine. It is a rugged little flash drive that looks very attractive, thats all I was expecting from it. It has already gotten a couple scratches from insertion after only a couple uses, but it only adds to its character.
customer_reviews.author: SpecialK

customer_reviews.title: Great flashdrive
customer_reviews.text: Love this flash drive. i have it hooked onto my keys, and it has been through rain, drops, dirt and still works perfectly fine. after formatting its 29GB, so you dont loose much, but thats with any flash drive. fast write speeds, only takes a few moments to transfer big files especially when hooked up to a usb 3.0 port on your laptop/pc. this also works great with my android devices, to work as a physical backup of all my pictures and videos.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great speed & size for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I got the 32GB version for $10 and I thought that was an excellent deal and still do! I do wish they made it in different colors or some way to differentiate one from another, but all in all I'm highly satisfied. As stated in some other reviews it is smaller than I had anticipated but that's not necessarily a good or bad thing depending on what you're looking for. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Allman

customer_reviews.title: Not the Fastest Rabbit in the Hutch
customer_reviews.text: Quick read times but writing is more like a USB 2 hard drive, maybe worse. This is running off a Macbook Pro with USB 3 ports. Probably quick for small files (utilizing it's cache?) but for larger transfer the thing slows down. Looks good though!
customer_reviews.author: Hmmm......

customer_reviews.title: love that its small and compact
customer_reviews.text: love that its small and compact, works well and good read and write speed. but it's missing activity light, i don' know when its done reading or writing. it's ashame i have to use the mouse to shut off or eject device before i unplug it to ensure there's no activity. unplugging it while activity can cause data damage.
customer_reviews.author: Wei Huang

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace my dying 16GB Adata thumb drive that I got on sale a while back, would plug in read correctly but when trying to transfer files it would disconnect. This new drive is a Samsung with double the memory for a cheaper price; a win/win situation there. Only complaint is that it does get warm when in use so watch your fingers. I have not really noticed any slow downs due to the heat as of yet, but then again I didn't do any stress tests with this.
customer_reviews.author: Hung Sewell

product_meta.title: Samsung 128GB BAR (METAL) USB 3.0 Flash Drive (MUF-128BA/AM)
product_meta.description: Size:128 GB| Color:MetallicElevate your memory storage with Samsung USB 3.0 technology. Get more mileage with a USB ideal for transfers between PCs and notebooks. Enjoy the best of both worlds with sleek, super-compact design as well as higher transfer speeds and rugged 5-proof durability.
feature_bullets: High-quality metal casing for durability with key ring to prevent loss
NAND Flash Technology, Up to 150MB/s Data Transfer Speed
Water proof, Shock proof, magnet proof, temp proof, and X-ray proof with a 5-year warranty
High-speed USB 3.0 flash drive for fast data transfer. Waterproof
Operating temperature is 0 to 60 degree celsius. Non-operating temperature is minus 10 to 70 degree celsius

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars6,358 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
